Description: Small miniature pottery vessel made of a Nile clay, roughly finished on the outside surface in a closed shape. The base thins out to a pointed but rounded end, the vessel has high shoulders and a short neck, the rim runs outwards and is mostly broken off. The opening in the vessel extends about half of the height. Some cracks on the outer surface from shaping the object. White accretions at the surface.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 202)
